steps.title: Getting Started with Codenvy
steps.content:
Codenvy is a cloud IDE with horizontally-scallable Docker runner microservices.

This tour takes 3 minutes.

steps.title: Start a runner
steps.content: You execute and test your projectwithin a Runner, which binds a Docker machine with the stack for the app.

steps.title: Interact with the generator
steps.content: Each run creates an isolated Runner instance with its own RAM. Your project's files and artifacts are copied into the Runner. You will see the docker output in the Console tab. Once the docker container has been provisioned and has started, you will be able to interact with the project files from the Terminal tab.

steps.title: Edit files
steps.content: Codenvy has key bindings for emacs, vi, and sublime along with syntax highlighting, auto-complete, quick-fix, and code folding.

steps.title: Temporary workspace
steps.content: This project is in a temporary workspace. Your work will be lost if you are idle.

steps.title: Save your work
steps.content: Persist will copy your project into a permanent workspace. Create a free account to get unlimited IDE time, private projects, and storage.
